qas.question: Where can Carrier account management systems be found?
What registers the insertion of a SIM card?
What are some connection settings in Windows 8?
Where can't Carrier account management systems be found?

context: Windows 8 also incorporates improved support for mobile broadband; <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>the operating system<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> can now detect the insertion of a SIM card and automatically configure connection settings (including <a3_0><b8_0>APNs and carrier branding<b8_0/><a3_0/>), and reduce its internet usage in order to conserve bandwidth on metered networks. Windows 8 also adds an integrated airplane mode setting to globally <a0_0><b4_0>disable all wireless connectivity<b4_0/><a0_0/> as well. Carriers can also offer account management systems through <a1_0><b5_0>Windows Store apps<b5_0/><a1_0/>, which can be automatically installed as a part of the connection process and offer usage statistics on their respective tile.
